speaker: MAN
line: The navy...wanted to hear my story. They said, I owed it to the dead, to tell them the truth. I told them where to stick the truth. I'm the last man who knows who killed the men aboard that submarine, who knows it was a suicide mission but I'll burn in hell before I tell the murderers who sent us there. your story, to make sure that justice is served. up with your captain.

speaker: MAN
line: Johansen did what he had to. That's war. Some are sacrificed so that others can live.

speaker: MAN
line: You gotta get us outta here!

speaker: MAN (VOICE OVER)
line: But when that door shut, I knew my life, all our lives have just been sacrificed.

speaker: SANFORD
line: Johansen! Open this door! Open this door! Johansen!

speaker: MAN (VOICE OVER)
line: For the 1st time, I saw the enemy who was killing us.

speaker: MAN (VOICE OVER)
line: That thing was causing the slow, painful deaths.

speaker: MAN
line: And I prayed, one of the Japanese depth charges would finish the job. of some sort.

speaker: MAN
line: The navy says we were sent to recover an A-bomb. That's why we got all these burns. Gimme a freaking break. Whatever it was, we were sent to guard it.

speaker: MAN
line: Before it slithered away, back to where it came from, back into the sea, back into who knows what.

speaker: MAN
line: That thing... is still down there! The navy will deny it... but you've got to make sure the truth gets out. I can trust you to do that, can't I Mr. Mulder?
Mr Mulder, looks at his partners)

speaker: THE CIGARETTE-SMOKING MAN
line: You can trust all of us.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Excuse me, where can I find Walter Skinner? He was brought in with a gunshot wound.

speaker: FULLER
line: Agent Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Agent Fuller.

speaker: FULLER
line: This is agent Caleca we got a call from the DC police.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How bad is he?

speaker: FULLER
line: We don't know. He's been in surgery.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What happened?

speaker: CALECA
line: Looked like some hot-head drew a gun in a coffee shop. Skinner happened to be in the way.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What do we have on the shooter?

speaker: FULLER
line: We have a description from the waitress. A handgun was recovered in the parking lot, unregistered, no prints. Our guys got 2 partials off the cash register.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hair and fiber?

speaker: FULLER
line: This just happened a few hours ago.

speaker: SCULLY
line: This is the assistant director who's been shot. We have to make all resources available.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Excuse me.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How is he? pain.

speaker: SKINNER (WHISPERING)
line: I've seen him before... the man who shot me.

speaker: MULDER
line: Give me the key.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: When we get there.

speaker: MULDER
line: I wanna make sure we get there together, give it to me.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: When we get there.

speaker: FULLER
line: How's he doing?

speaker: SCULLY
line: He's on steady Demerol, he's in and out. I thought I asked for guards to be posted outside.

speaker: CALECA
line: We put in a request with the DC police.

speaker: SCULLY
line: This wasn't a random shooting. I want guards posted here and I want them here now!

speaker: FULLER
line: I think it's a matter of pulling men on something else.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I've heard the excuses. I don't care if you and agent Caleca have to stand in the hallway yourself. This man has to be protected. Okay?

speaker: MULDER
line: We're being followed. A dark sedan with its lights off. It was parked on the shoulder about half a mile back. Speed up. Speed up!

speaker: KRYCEK
line: I don't have it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I got a message you called.

speaker: MAN
line: Good morning, we found something I knew you wanted to see ASAP.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's on the shooter?

speaker: MAN
line: Yeah, the partial prints we pulled out of the cash register didn't add up to anything. We found saliva on Skinner's shirt that wasn't his. This is an analysis of the secretors and other hemofactors.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Which tells us we're looking for a male, probably in his 40s with blood type B positive, but we already know all that from the waitress' description.

speaker: MAN
line: There's more. We were able to chromosome-stain some of the hair fibers we picked up last night.

speaker: SCULLY
line: We still gotta find the guy before we can get a match.

speaker: MAN
line: We can still run those indicators against all the suspects arrested in the DC area in the last couple of years.

speaker: SCULLY
line: This takes too much time. You know what, run them anyway. Can I borrow you this for a little while?

speaker: MAN
line: Go ahead.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Thanks.

speaker: CSM
line: What's the prognosis? rapid effect on cellular activity, giving rise to the onset of massive and malignant cancers.

speaker: CSM
line: Has anyone been in to see these men? looks through the bandages of the sick man, his eyes still move). But I think we should get a specialist in here because, frankly, I've never seen anything like this before.

speaker: CSM
line: I have.

speaker: CSM
line: Have the bodies destroyed.

speaker: CSM
line: Isn't that the prognosis?

speaker: MULDER
line: Guess I'm not dead.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What happened?

speaker: MULDER
line: Maybe you can tell me.

speaker: SCULLY
line: The State police found you unconscious. You were strapped in the passenger's seat of a rental car that had been driven into a ditch.

speaker: MULDER
line: We were run off the road by 2 men.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Who's "we"?

speaker: MULDER
line: Krycek.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Krycek?

speaker: MULDER
line: He was in Hong Kong, he's got the digital tape. He's been selling information.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Is that what the men wanted?

speaker: MULDER
line: They ordered him out of the car. I thought they were going to kill him. I though they were going to kill us both. And then there was this bright flash. That's all I remember.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well it may not be the best time to tell you but, you're not the only one in the hospital. Skinner's been shot.

speaker: MULDER
line: What's his condition?

speaker: SCULLY
line: A bullet perforated his small intestine. The doctor seems to think he'll be fine.

speaker: MULDER
line: Who shot him?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm not sure. But I have an idea.

speaker: MULDER
line: What are those?

speaker: SCULLY
line: PCR results this one belongs to the man who shot Skinner.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah and who's this one belong to?

speaker: SCULLY
line: The man who shot Melissa.

speaker: WELL-MANICURED MAN
line: How could they have gotten information about that location? denied any involvement.

speaker: WELL-MANICURED MAN
line: Well they got those coordinates somehow.

speaker: WELL-MANICURED MAN
line: Has our associate in Washington looked into this? think any of us would have anticipated.

speaker: WELL-MANICURED MAN
line: How do you mean? and explain it himself.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hi, how are you feeling?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Like someone's been inside my stomach redecorating. What have you turned up on the shooter?

speaker: SCULLY
line: We've determined that the man who shot you was the same man who shot my sister.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I bet you had to work to get that, huh?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes I did, you don't seem surprised.

speaker: SKINNER
line: 3 men came to see me a few days ago, they warned me about pursuing your sister's murder investigation.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Do you realize what you're saying sir?

speaker: SKINNER
line: I'm not advancing any conspiracy theory here Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You're saying, that they closed down my sister's case not because of lack of evidence but because they didn't want us to catch the killer.

speaker: SKINNER
line: You should be very careful about the accusations that you make.

speaker: SCULLY
line: The man who shot you.. you said that you've seen him before.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Several months ago, he was one of the men who attacked me in the stairway,with Krycek.

speaker: SCULLY
line: He was working with Krycek?

speaker: SKINNER
line: They're the ones who stole the digital tape from me.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Damn it! Krycek, Mulder had him.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Listen to me, anger is a luxury that you cannot afford right now. If you're angry you're gonna make a mistake, and these people will take advantage of that, you've seen how they operate

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'll be ok

speaker: SKINNER
line: Scully.. if you can't keep your head.. it's all right to step away.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's exactly what they want

speaker: SCULLY
line: : Addendum to case number 621517, in the absence of any official response my request to have my sister's case reopened, I am now petitioning to devote full Bureau resources to the search for Alex Krycek. Since agent Mulder's release from the hospital, we have had no success locating Krycek or the 2 men he described as his abductors. Personally, I believe Krycek is the key to identify the larger forces behind the crime we are investigating. He alone can name the man who shot my sister, and explain the strange radiation deaths aboard the French salvage vessel.

speaker: MULDER
line: It looked great on me in the store.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What's this doing here?

speaker: MULDER
line: I had it flown it from San Diego as evidence.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Evidence of what?

speaker: MULDER
line: The suit was covered in a thin film of oil, as was the French diver when I found him lying delirious on his kitchen floor.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What kind of oil?

speaker: MULDER
line: Well from the reports I'm getting, it's the same substance that was found on the French diver's wife when she was discovered on the floor of a Hong Kong airport bathroom a few days ago. According to the analysis, it's 50-weight diesel oil. It's the same oil that was used during World War II submarines and on P-51 Mustangs for that matter.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't understand.

speaker: MULDER
line: This oil is not only 50 years old Scully, but its composition has been altered by exposure to radiation.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I still don't understand how did this get onto the diver and then onto the diver's wife.

speaker: MULDER
line: This just wasn't ordinary diesel oil, I think it's huh.. I think it's a medium, a medium being used by some kind of alien creature that uses it to .. body jump.

speaker: SCULLY
line: So you're saying that this stuff has intelligence.

speaker: MULDER
line: I think that it came off of whatever they pulled from the bottom of the Pacific ocean, it's been waiting 50 years down there for another host, another body to bring it up to the surface.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Waiting to jump into the diver and then into the diver's wife.

speaker: MULDER
line: And then into Krycek.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Krycek?

speaker: MULDER
line: I think that Mrs Gauthier went to Hong Kong under the control of this thing to find Krycek. I know, I know how it sounds.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Is anybody not looking for Krycek?

speaker: MULDER
line: No but I think that the 64 thousand dollar question is what is this thing looking for? And now that it's in Krycek, what does it want?

speaker: BYERS
line: You should call upon our service more often.

speaker: LANGLY
line: We show a talent for these G-man activities.

speaker: MULDER
line: You mean if I want somebody whacked on the knee with a lead pipe?

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Only if you want the job done right.

speaker: MULDER
line: It's gone.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Where is it? expecting you. Put that down. I have what you want.

speaker: CSM
line: There was a weather delay on the shuttle from Washington.

speaker: WELL-MANICURED MAN
line: You had business there?

speaker: CSM
line: Yes. You huh.. may have already heard another location.

speaker: CSM
line: These new attempts to recover it have increased our need for security.

speaker: WELL-MANICURED MAN
line: Who else is looking for it? look for it.

speaker: CSM
line: I can assure you it will be completely inaccessible now.

speaker: CSM
line: Leaks in security and a heightened public interest have made the base of Nevada unviable. Is this why I was called here?

speaker: WELL MANICURED MAN
line: No, we'd like an explanation about this business with the assistant director of the Bureau, Skinner.

speaker: CSM
line: Random shooting for all I know.

speaker: WELL MANICURED MAN
line: They have a waitress, who has given a description of the shooter, they released a composite of his face to the press. One of yours, isn't he?

speaker: CSM
line: I don't know what to tell you. If he did, he acted on his own.

speaker: WELL MANICURED MAN
line: Good lord.

speaker: CSM
line: I'll take care of it.

speaker: WELL MANICURED MAN
line: My advice to you sir, is to understand the priority here, get the shooter out of the country as quickly as possible, if the assistant director IDs him, our well placed operatives won't be able to stand in the way of an arrest, compromising beyond repair the secrecy of our work, and the security as you so arrogantly assert of our project's future.

speaker: CSM
line: It'll be handled.

speaker: MULDER
line: Let me see that.

speaker: BYERS
line: Your guys at the FBI turned a major serial murderer with a vestigial pen impression.

speaker: MULDER
line: Hand me a pencil.

speaker: LANGLY
line: Your sci-crime guys at the Bureau have a laser there that can measure any change in a surface down to a few nanometers

speaker: BYERS
line: Actually they can lift perfect impression using magnetic toner and a sheet of mylar an electrostatic device is applied to the specimen, and renders the information, by drawing the toner from the indentation to the mylar surface.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Actually..

speaker: MULDER
line: Actually, it's a phone number, New York City area code , 555 1012. Now don't drop that that's a finely calibrated piece of investigative equipment. I gotta make a phone call.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: I'll be damned.

speaker: MAN
line: Yes? No this is a private line, you must have misdialed. No there's no one here to take your call. I'm sorry I can't help you. Please hold on.

speaker: WELL-MANICURED MAN
line: Who is this?

speaker: MULDER
line: Who is this?

speaker: WELL-MANICURED MAN
line: Who gave you this number?

speaker: MULDER
line: You probably know. A man named Krycek.

speaker: WELL-MANICURED MAN
line: Alex Krycek?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah nice guy, killed my father, you wouldn't happen to know where he is, do you?

speaker: WELL-MANICURED MAN
line: It's Mr Mulder isn't it?

speaker: MULDER
line: It's so nice of you to remember.

speaker: WELL-MANICURED MAN
line: Mr Mulder, can we meet somewhere?

speaker: MULDER
line: I would love to.

speaker: WELL-MANICURED MAN
line: Give your phone number to my assistant, he will call you back in 5 minutes. Tell him I'll meet him in 3 hours in Central Park, near the lighted walkway off 79th, near the reservoir. When you hang up, have this number disconnected.

speaker: FULLER
line: Well we got a name to go with the face.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Beautiful.

speaker: FULLER
line: His name is Luis Cardinal , native of Nicaragua, school of the America's alumni, career mercenary, apparently impressed a lot of people with his marksmanship during the Iran contra deal.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'll bet.

speaker: FULLER
line: That's actually the good news.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What do you mean?

speaker: CALECA
line: He entered the country without a visa or papers. As far as we can tell we can't find anything on him, address, phone number, financials, nothing.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Does he have an alias?

speaker: CALECA
line: Several, non-checked out either in all likelihood, this guy's already out of the country.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Damn it, they think they can just get away with it.

speaker: FULLER
line: I wish I could tell you otherwise.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Keep looking for him.

speaker: FULLER
line: We.. pretty much exhausted our avenues.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What's it gonna take?

speaker: CALECA
line: At this point? Other than a sign from God?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I've seen stranger things, believe me.

speaker: MAN
line: I believe she has.

speaker: WELL MANICURED MAN
line: I trust we're all alone.

speaker: MULDER
line: We're all alone in New York City, sir.

speaker: WELL MANICURED MAN
line: You're looking for Alex Krycek, to kill him, in revenge. What makes you think we haven't done that already?

speaker: MULDER
line: What for?

speaker: WELL MANICURED MAN
line: Tell me what you know and I'll consider giving you Krycek.

speaker: MULDER
line: No, you'll answer a few questions for me first, like what was pulled off the bottom of the Pacific ocean.

speaker: WELL MANICURED MAN
line: It was a UFO, a so called foo-fighter, downed by American fighter pilots in the 2nd World War.

speaker: MULDER
line: Left out until now?

speaker: WELL MANICURED MAN
line: There was salvage attempts. A US sub was sent in 50 years ago, but there were complications.

speaker: MULDER
line: Almost the entire crew died.

speaker: WELL MANICURED MAN
line: Yeah, it's still a mystery.

speaker: MULDER
line: A mystery to whom?

speaker: WELL MANICURED MAN
line: The cover story said it was the 3rd A bomb bound to Japan, but the truth is, no one knows what killed that crew.

speaker: MULDER
line: I know.

speaker: WELL MANICURED MAN
line: Do you now?

speaker: MULDER
line: You give me Krycek and I will tell you.

speaker: WELL MANICURED MAN
line: Mr Mulder, I've given you so much this evening, you offered me next to nothing in return.

speaker: MULDER
line: You haven't told me anything I didn't already know.

speaker: WELL MANICURED MAN
line: I'm curious, if you've encountered Krycek, why didn't you kill him then?

speaker: MULDER
line: 'Cause he has the tape.

speaker: WELL MANICURED MAN
line: Ahh yes, the tape .

speaker: MULDER
line: The tape he's been selling those secrets off. You don't know where he is either, do you? You're looking for him too.

speaker: WELL MANICURED MAN
line: Mr Mulder, everyone can be gotten to, certainly, you've no doubt of that. Mr Mulder?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Scully.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully it's me. The 2 guards you had posted in front of Skinner's room, are they still there?

speaker: SCULLY
line: They should be why?

speaker: MULDER
line: I want you to get down there and double check for me, ok?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I got it covered Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: Just get down there and check, ok?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Nurse, what happened to the guards who were outside this room?

speaker: NURSE
line: They've left.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where did they go? And what happened to the man who was in this room?

speaker: NURSE
line: Mr Skinner is no longer a patient here.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where is he?

speaker: NURSE
line: Well the oderlies were here a few moments ago, and they took him away.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where did they take him?

speaker: NURSE
line: To another hospital, the ambulance must have just left.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Thank you. Walter Skinner?

speaker: DRIVER
line: yeah, is there something wrong?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No everything is fine, I'm just gonna ride with you the rest of the way, ok?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Agent Scully, what are you doing here?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I just wanted to make sure you got where you were going safely.

speaker: SKINNER
line: What is this Scully?

speaker: SCULLY
line: You just lie still

speaker: SCULLY
line: Federal agent stop right there! Are you Luis Cardinal?! Are you Luis Cardinal?!

speaker: CARDINAL
line: Please.

speaker: CARDINAL
line: Don't kill me, please.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You shot my sister!

speaker: CARDINAL
line: Please I can tell you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Tell me!

speaker: CARDINAL
line: I can tell you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Tell me!

speaker: CARDINAL
line: I can tell you what you want, you want Krycek, I can tell you where he is? Please, please don't shoot me.

speaker: OFFICER
line: Don't move.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah Mulder.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder it's me, where are you?

speaker: MULDER
line: At the airport in New York.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What are you doing?

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm looking for my rental car agreement.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What are you doing in New York?

speaker: MULDER
line: I'll tell you when I see you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, your instincts were right about Skinner. We've just arrested a man for what looks like attempted murder.

speaker: MULDER
line: Who?

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's him Mulder, the man who shot my sister.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully..

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder listen to me, he said he knows where Krycek is. I don't know if this makes any sense to you, he says he's headed towards an abandoned missile site somewhere in North Dakota.

speaker: MULDER
line: I want you to meet me at the DC airport in an hour, I want you to get 2 tickets on the 1st flight for North Dakota.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What's in North Dakota?

speaker: MULDER
line: The salvaged UFO.

speaker: SCULLY
line: There must be 200 silos out here. If I'm correct they were all filled with concrete in accord with the disarmament treaty when the base was decommissioned.

speaker: MULDER
line: I didn't sign any disarmament treaty.

speaker: SCULLY
line: My ears are still popping.

speaker: MULDER
line: We're 8 stories down.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where's the concrete?

speaker: MULDER
line: Apparently, nobody else signed that treaty either.

speaker: SCULLY
line: 1 down, 199 silos to go.

speaker: MULDER
line: These tunnels must go on for miles.

speaker: MULDER
line: He's here.

speaker: MAN
line: Hold it right there!

speaker: MAN
line: Hold!

speaker: MAN
line: Hands in the air! Come on! Come on!

speaker: MULDER
line: He's here. You led him here, didn't you?

speaker: CSM
line: There's nothing here but holes in the ground Mr Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why are you here? Why all these men?

speaker: CSM
line: I don't know, you owe me answers.

speaker: MULDER
line: The UFO's here. That's what Krycek's after, isn't it?

speaker: CSM
line: Krycek? Alex Krycek disappeared 5 months ago.

speaker: SCULLY
line: We saw bodies in there. Men with radiation burns!

speaker: CSM
line: You saw nothing .

speaker: MULDER
line: You won't get away with this! You can't bury the truth!

speaker: CSM
line: Take these away.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah. Sir, I didn't expect you back to work for a few weeks.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I was looking for agent Scully, there was something I wanted to talk to her about, thank you.

speaker: MULDER
line: Actually I wanted to talk to you, I wanted to thank you for everything you did.

speaker: SKINNER
line: You mean getting a shot in the gut?

speaker: MULDER
line: You got a shot because you stood up to these people.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I think you're perceiving from a mistaken impression, what I did, I did it because it's my job.

speaker: MULDER
line: From what I understand, you put your job and your life on the line for Scully.

speaker: SKINNER
line: This isn't my crusade agent Mulder. A woman was murdered, I mistakenly thought that we could bring the man who committed that crime to justice.

speaker: MULDER
line: What do you mean mistakenly?

speaker: SKINNER
line: This is what I need to talk to Scully about. 1962-1995)

speaker: SCULLY
line: I was just thinking about something that a man said to me. That the.. that the dead speak to us from beyond the grave, that that what's conscience is.

speaker: MULDER
line: It's interesting, I never thought of it that way.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You know I thought... when we found him, this man that killed Melissa, that..that when we brought him to justice, I would feel some kind of closure. But the truth is no court.. no punishment is ever enough.

speaker: MULDER
line: I came here to tell you something there may be some justice, just not the kind you're looking for.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What are you talking about?

speaker: MULDER
line: They found this man, Luis Cardinal, dead in his cell.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How?

speaker: MULDER
line: They made it look like a suicide. The men he worked for couldn't take the chance that he point his finger at them.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And what about Krycek?

speaker: MULDER
line: Oh he was there. I know that.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You think they got to him too.

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't know, but if they haven't they will. I doubt it'll weight on their consciences though.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I think the dead are speaking to us Mulder, demanding justice. Maybe that man was right. Maybe we bury the dead alive.

speaker: KRYCEK'S VOICE
line: Help! Help! Help! Help me! Help me! Help me!
